events.message: The customer reported that their car was involved in a collision at an intersection yesterday evening.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the keywords identified in the initial report.
An agent specializing in vehicle accident claims was assigned to the case to handle further proceedings.
The insurer acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the customer that the process would begin shortly.
The customer was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and a copy of their driver’s license.
The customer provided all requested documents including detailed images of the car damage and the official accident report.
The claims investigation team initiated the review of the submitted evidence and began contacting involved parties.
The investigation concluded that the collision was caused by a third party and the customer’s claim is valid.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount covering the repair costs and loss of use for the customer’s vehicle.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved after the customer agreed to the terms and settlement proposal.
The settlement payment was issued to the customer’s account to cover repair expenses and additional damages.
The claim was formally closed following payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that all matters were resolved.
The case files and documentation were archived for future reference in accordance with the company’s data retention policy.
